author: lgo
msg: Edited wiki page through web user interface.

author: lgo
msg: Make the tests that make use of the test server more deterministic. Keep track
of the actual messages (instead of handling those as raw data), and allow the
server to ignore some of them before killing a connection, if we know the client
should retry those messages on the new connection.
Use socket events to correctly determine when to read or write data.
(struct kind): Add new kinds of server actions.
(test_baton_t): Add some new members to handle messages and outstanding
(test_server_create): Function now takes a list of expected messages and a
(replay): Split the actions list in two: messages and actions. Read messages
when data is available (and only then), initiate actions when it's possible
(test_server_create): Update definition to match the new declaration.
test_serf_progress_callback): Update the tests. Keep both a message list
and an action list. Pass both to the function that creates a new test
server. Fix some conditions when we expect the client-server traffic to
